item.title: Xbox Q2 2025 Earnings Results Show Revenue Decline, But Revenue Growth With Game Pass
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/xbox-q2-2025-results/

Microsoft’s Q2 2025 (October – December 2024) has revealed Xbox’s gaming revenue declined, but saw slight growth in via game pass.

Cut to the Chase

Xbox’s key points for Q2 2025 are:

  • Gaming revenue declined 7% (down 8% CC)
  • Xbox content and services revenue grew 2% driven by growth in Xbox Game Pass
  • Xbox hardware revenue declined 29%

What Does it Mean?

It’s always hard to judge the long term effects of quarterly financials as they don’t paint a broader picture of the company as a whole. On first impressions, Xbox content and services revenue growth by 2% seems like a good indicator for Xbox Game Pass, but during the months in which the hotly anticipated Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 released, I would have expected a little more movement. However, its growth matches Microsoft’s guidance at 2%

Xbox’s revenue decline is something that we should hopefully see changed in the coming months, as Xbox’s new strategy is to release its games across more platforms and thus, increase revenues. But again, it’s somewhat surprising considering a big quarter with Call of Duty.

Xbox’s hardware revenue decline shows a sharp decrease at 29%, which is frankly a shocking statistic during the holiday period. For context, Xbox hardware grew by 3% during the same quarter last year. That being said, Xbox’s new focus on the cloud will undoubtedly have an negative impact on hardware sales.

Would you this of Xbox’s financial results for Q2 2025? Let us know in the comments below or on our community forum!

item.title: Score Yourself an Ice-Cold Nuka-Cola Wild in Fallout 76
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/nuka-cola-wild-in-fallout-76/

Is there anything like the refreshing taste of an ice-cold Nuka-Cola after finishing an Expedition to Atlantic City? But what if you’re craving something different, like a Nuka-Cola Wild? Here is where to find Nuka Cola Wild in Fallout 76!

Where to Find Nuka Cola Wild in Fallout 76

You can find Nuka Cola Wild in Fallout 76 by purchasing one from Bubbles at The Whitespring Resort. Alternatively, you can find a single bottle at Eta Psi House on Fraternity Row, just inside the basement, with all of the Nuka-Cola merchandise and theming.

If you intend to visit Bubbles and buy their stock of Nuka-Cold Wild, along with all the other unique flavors, you better bring a fat stack of caps. At almost 40 caps per bottle, Wild will set you back somewhat!

But what makes Nuka-Cold Wild so unique and refreshing? It’s the company’s answer to the ever-popular Sunset Sarsaparilla from out west, toward New Vegas. The soda pop features a distinctive flavor profile meant to compete with Nuka-Cola’s direct competitor, the Sunset Sarsaparilla Company, after the former failed to buy out the latter in a corporate takeover.

Related: Make Your Way to Huntersville in Fallout 76 for Power Armor and Loot

Nuka Cola Wild Stats in Fallout 76

In addition to its unique flavor and color, Nuka-Cola Wild has distinct effects that make it ideal for anyone traveling alone in Appalachia for extended periods.

The massive boost to Hit Points and Action Points makes Nuka-Cold Wild in Fallout 76 the go-to beverage for those running low on Stimpaks or running various perks that boost the effects of food and drink items.

The +5 Rads isn’t too terrible, either. You can deal with a bit of radiation, right?

What flavor of Nuka-Cola do you think would taste best in the real world? Let us know your thoughts in the comments, and share a few screenshots of your character in Fallout 76 over at the Insider Gaming community forums!

Do you know what goes well with a Nuka-Cola Wild? You can find a fresh gourd in a few spots across the world of Fallout 76!

item.title: Bend Studio Cuts Contractors Following Live-Service God of War Cancelation
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/bend-studio-layoffs-contractors/

Several Bend Studio contractors have reported on their LinkedIn profiles that they will no longer be working at Bend Studio from February 14.

The news comes just two weeks after it was reported that PlayStation had cancelled two of its live service projects, one of which was a live-service God of War game by Bend Studio.

The number of those effected is currently unclear, but according to some posts, only a handful of contractors were given full-time opportunities, while others where let go.

Bend Studio’s game cancelled means that the studio has not published a game since Days Gone in 2019, which sold 7.32 million units by February 2022, a number obtained by the Insomniac Games leaks.

With current game development timelines, it means that almost certainly it will be a decade between Days Gone and whatever is next for Bend Studio.

It’s currently unclear on if anyone at Bluepoint, another studio who faced a project cancelation has been effected.

What do you think Bend Studio will be working on next? Would you like to see Days Gone 2? Let us know in the comments below or on our community forum!

For more Insider Gaming, check out our report on Marvel Snap finding a new publisher after the US ban fiasco. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: BioWare Moves Some Employees to Other EA Projects While Developing Mass Effect 5
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/bioware-moves-some-employees-to-other-ea-projects-while-developing-mass-effect-5/

In the latest BioWare update on the development of the next Mass Effect stage, the developer says it does not “require support from the full studio,” and has moved several employees to other teams at Electronic Arts. While the developer says it is reimaging how the company works, it still touts the leadership of veterans of the original trilogy.

Following the release of Dragon Age: The Veilguard, a “core team at BioWare” is hard at work on the next Mass Effect game, the company wrote in a blog post today. However, an unclear number of employees have been moved to “other teams at EA that had open roles that were a strong fit.” IGN has also reported that a small number of Dragon Age team members have had their roles terminated.

In their post, BioWare highlighted members of the veteran leadership leading production on the next Mass Effect game:

  • Michael Gamble: Manager and Producer on Mass Effect 2, Mass Effect 3, and Andromeda.
  • Preston Watamaniuk: Lead Designer on the original trilogy.
  • Parrish Ley: Cinematic Animator for the original trilogy.
  • Derek Watts: Art Director for the original trilogy.

Many believe this next Mass Effect title is a make-or-break release for BioWare. Dragon Age: The Veilguard went through a lengthy, turbulent development cycle, and despite some critical success, the 1.5 million copies sold was half of what Electronic Arts expected. This combined with EA Sports FC 25 missing internal expectations resulted in a massive 17% drop in EA’s stock value. Veilguard’s game director Corrine Busch left the company earlier this month, after 18 years with the company.

Does this change cause concern for Mass Effect 5? Let us know in the comments below or on our community forum!

For more Insider Gaming, check out our report on Marvel Snap finding a new publisher after the US ban fiasco. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 Full PC Specs Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/marvels-spider-man-2-full-pc-specs-revealed/

The full specifications for the PC release of Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 have been revealed a day before the acclaimed game’s anticipated PC launch. The spectacular Spider-Man sequel from developers Insomniac will feature options like raytracing and ultra-wide monitor support, as well as a wide variety of graphical presets.

Here’s the full breakdown of requirements you’ll need to swing through New York in Marvel’s Spider-Man 2.

Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 Full PC Specs

The game requires 140 GB of SSD storage and a Windows 10/11 G4-bit operating system (version 1909 or higher) to run at any graphical preset level.

Minimum Specs

  • Graphics Preset: Very Low
  • Graphics Card (GPU): NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 or better | AMD Radeon RX 5500 XT or better
  • Processor (CPU): Intel Core i3-8100 or better | AMD Ryzen 3 3100 or better
  • Memory (RAM): 16 GB
  • Average Performance: 720p, 30 FPS

Recommended Specs

  • Graphics Preset: Medium
  • Graphics Card (GPU): NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 or better | AMD Radeon RX 5700 or better
  • Processor (CPU): Intel Core i5-8400 or better | AMD Ryzen 5 3600 or better
  • Memory (RAM): 16 GB
  • Average Performance: 1060p, 60 FPS

High Specs

  • Graphics Preset: High
  • Graphics Card (GPU): NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 or better | AMD Radeon RX 6800 or better
  • Processor (CPU): Intel Core i5-11400 or better | AMD Ryzen 5 5600 or better
  • Memory (RAM): 16 GB
  • Average Performance: 1440p, 60 FPS

High Ray Tracing

  • Graphics Preset: High/Ray Tracing High
  • Graphics Card (GPU): NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 or better | AMD Radeon RX 7900 XT or better
  • Processor (CPU): Intel Core i5-11600K or better | AMD Ryzen 5 5600X or better
  • Memory (RAM): 16 GB
  • Average Performance: 1060p, 60 FPS

Very High Ray Tracing

  • Graphics Preset: High/Ray Tracing Very High
  • Graphics Card (GPU): NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4080 or better | AMD Radeon RX 7900 XTX or better
  • Processor (CPU): Intel Core 75-12700K or better | AMD Ryzen 9 5900X or better
  • Memory (RAM): 16 GB
  • Average Performance: 1060p, 60 FPS

Ultimate Ray Tracing

  • Graphics Preset: Very High/Ray Tracing Ultiamte
  • Graphics Card (GPU): NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4090 or better
  • Processor (CPU): Intel Core i9-12900K or better | AMD Ryzen 7 7800X3D or better
  • Memory (RAM): 32 GB
  • Average Performance: 1060p, 60 FPS

Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 comes to Steam and the Epic Games Store on January 30, 2025. To celebrate the launch, the primary suit in the game, Peter Parker’s Advanced Suit 2.0, will be available to purchase and use in Marvel Rivals starting tonight.

Can you PC handle Marvel’s Spider-Man 2?  Let us know in the comments, or head to the Insider Gaming community forums.
